wiki.content:
"Blaze of Glory (Theme from Young Guns II)" is a song by Jon Bon Jovi which reached No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1990,his only chart-topper away from his band Bon Jovi. The song also reached No. 1 on the Billboard Album Rock Tracks chart. "Blaze of Glory (Theme from Young Guns II)" also topped the ARIA music chart in Australia for a total of six weeks, and reached No. 13 on the UK Singles Chart.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Blaze of Glory (Theme from Young Guns II)" is a song by Jon Bon Jovi which reached No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1990,his only chart-topper away from his band Bon Jovi. The song also reached No. 1 on the Billboard Album Rock Tracks chart. "Blaze of Glory (Theme from Young Guns II)" also topped the ARIA music chart in Australia for a total of six weeks, and reached No. 13 on the UK Singles Chart.

track.name: Blaze Of Glory
comments: So? It still is a Jon Bon Jovi song. Not Running Anymore and Old Habits Die hard are in the deluxe version of What About Now and that doesn't made them Bon Jovi songs, the same with Every Road Leads Home To You of Richie's solo record, that's a bonus track on WAN.
Young Guns
"It's because it's on the Crossroads 'Best of...' record, which is labeled as a Bon Jovi record." Niektórzy może słuchają właśnie tak?
this is not Bon Jovi song. it's Jon's solo track, from his album "Blaze of Glory". so i don't understand why it's tagged Bon Jovi as a band. [2] masz rację ale inni i tak inaczej uważają -.-

Pretty song from Jon!
